p: Physical examinations, radiological imaging, and biopsy tests are performed in non-small-cell lung cancer, and the staging is based on the outcome of these investigations. Surgery can be performed in order to determine the pathological stage of cancer by direct examination of biopsies [ 77]. Most medical centers and hospitals have adopted the TNM staging system used in the staging of cancer where T is the size of the tumor; N is the number of lymph nodes that are infected, while M refers to the level of metastasis [ 78].
